newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai interbank rate eases, baht weaker late.
newsitem.headline: Thai interbank rate eases, baht weaker late.

text.p: The Thai overnight interbank rate fell to 11.50-12.00 percent in late trade on Tuesday from 13.00 percent early on higher liquidity after the central bank's reserve requirement passed, dealers said.
"The reserve requirement has passed. So most banks began to lend their excess funds," said one dealer at a local bank.
Dealers expect the liquidity to be easier on Thursday due to a lack of spending needs following the passing of the reserve requirment which came due today.
Thai financial markets will be closed on Wednesday due to a public holiday.
The baht was down to 25.482-25.487 to to the dollar near the close from 25.481-25.484 early on strong dollar buying, dealers said.
"Dollar buying remained heavy today. People believe the dollar is still on an uptrend abroad," said one currency dealer.
One-month baht/dollar swap premium was quoted at 7.75/8.50 satangs per dollar late from 8.25/9.25 early.
The baht/dollar mid-rate was fixed by the Bank of Thailand at 25.47 against 25.48 on Monday.
